extracted_data_phrases: in regard to their rightful authority
disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents in regard to their rightful authority, especially when they offered guidance or directives that would have benefited me?
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

disobedience.question: Did I reject the unity of the Church when frustrated by those who share my faith, yet struggle to live it?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did I skip obligatory days such as Ash Wednesday, failing to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

disobedience.question: Did I mock the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

disobedience.question: Did I speak disrespectfully about the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

condoning.question: Did I lead other Catholics to believe it is acceptable to stay away from Sacraments or Mass, through my words?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

extracted_data_phrases: by saying nothing to them about missing Mass or Sacraments
condoning.question: Did I lead other Catholics astray by saying nothing to them about missing Mass or Sacraments?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

extracted_data_phrases: from participation in sacraments , such as Mass
condoning.question: Did I lead fellow Catholics away from participation in sacraments, such as Mass, through my words?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

extracted_data_phrases: by avoiding a difficult conversation , perhaps out of fear or discomfort
perhaps out of fear or discomfort
condoning.question: Did I permit my child to continue in error by avoiding a difficult conversation, perhaps out of fear or discomfort?
condoning.description: Permitting a child to continue in error by avoiding difficult conversations is sinful because it neglects our God-given parental duty to guide and form our children's moral and spiritual development, placing our own comfort above their eternal wellbeing.

condoning.question: Did I condone a funeral where a loved one's remains were scattered instead of buried?
condoning.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

extracted_data_phrases: through my silence or lack of opposition
condoning.question: Did I condone another Catholic to marry outside the Church through my silence or lack of opposition?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

condoning.question: Did I give my approval, through words, to another Catholic who was considering marrying outside of the Church?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

extracted_data_phrases: through words to another Catholic who chose to marry outside the Church
to another Catholic who chose to marry outside the Church
condoning.question: Did I give silent approval through words to another Catholic who chose to marry outside the Church?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

extracted_data_phrases: from those who are homeless or displaced
uncharity.question: Do I turn away from those who are homeless or displaced?
uncharity.description: Per the corporal works of mercy, we are to love our neighbors by feeding the hungry and sheltering the homeless and respecting their dignity especially in times of hardship.

uncharity.description: Per the corporal works of mercy, we are to love our neighbors by feeding the hungry and sheltering the homeless and respecting their dignity especially in times of hardship.

on their occupation , nationality , or other characteristics that are beyond their control

uncharity.description: This sin dehumanizes people on the margins when we are called to love each other as a child of God as Jesus loved us.

extracted_data_phrases: over the needs of those in your life who are struggling
of those in your life who are struggling

uncharity.description: This is considered sinful because excessive self-focus and selfishness violates Christ's command to love our neighbors as ourselves and contradicts the Christian call to practice charity, compassion, and self-sacrifice for others.

uncharity.question: Did I let my own interests overshadow the needs and well-being of those around me?
uncharity.description: This is considered sinful because excessive self-focus and selfishness violates Christ's command to love our neighbors as ourselves and contradicts the Christian call to practice charity, compassion, and self-sacrifice for others.

extracted_data_phrases: in a way that disrespects their dignity as beloved children of God

extracted_data_phrases: in situations where I could have intervened
uncharity.question: Did I permit someone else to be treated unfairly in situations where I could have intervened?
uncharity.description: This sin violates the principles of justice, charity, and our moral obligation to defend human dignity and protect our neighbors from harm when we have the ability to intervene.

uncharity.question: Did I stand by while someone else was treated unfairly?
uncharity.description: This sin violates the principles of justice, charity, and our moral obligation to defend human dignity and protect our neighbors from harm when we have the ability to intervene.

extracted_data_phrases: particularly in situations where I had the ability to intervene

uncharity.description: This sin violates the principles of justice, charity, and our moral obligation to defend human dignity and protect our neighbors from harm when we have the ability to intervene.

extracted_data_phrases: such as neighbors , acquaintances , or strangers who have requested help

uncharity.description: Failing to help those in need violates Christ's direct command to love our neighbor and care for the poor, effectively refusing to recognize Jesus Himself in the suffering of others.

lukewarmness.description: Lukewarmness in spiritual growth is sinful because one essentially chooses comfort and mediocrity over the transformative love God offers, which Jesus specifically warned against in Revelation 3:16.

merciless.question: Have I spoken harsh judgments against others?
merciless.description: Condemning others is a sin of mercilessness because it places oneself in God's role as judge and denies others the same mercy and forgiveness that God extends to all of us.

vainglory.description: Seeking praise for charitable giving is sinful because it transforms an act meant to glorify God and help others into an exercise of pride and self-glorification.

vainglory.description: Seeking praise for charitable giving is sinful because it transforms an act meant to glorify God and help others into an exercise of pride and self-glorification.

envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: in using words that were vulgar or inappropriate , thereby offending others
incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control in using words that were vulgar or inappropriate, thereby offending others?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in a manner that was lacking in reverence for their dignity
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others in a manner that was lacking in reverence for their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.question: Have you, in your eating or drinking, overindulged beyond what's reasonable?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: to an unhealthy preoccupation with worldly pleasures
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking, leading to an unhealthy preoccupation with worldly pleasures?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in sharing others ' private affairs through casual conversations
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs through casual conversations, even if what was shared seemed trivial or harmless?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' personal struggles, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: about acquaintances ' private lives for entertainment
gossip.question: Have I shared details about acquaintances' private lives for entertainment, even if what I said was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Did I perform work on a Sunday, even though it could have been avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

extracted_data_phrases: for purposes other than rest , worship , and devotion to God
than rest , worship , and devotion to God
impiety.question: Did I use my Sunday for purposes other than rest, worship, and devotion to God when otherwise it could be avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).
